greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Largest cube dividing n.
comment: Multiplicative with a(p^e) = p^(3[e/3]). - _Mitch Harris_, Apr 19 2005
link: Harvey P. Dale, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..1000
Vaclav Kotesovec, Graph - the asymptotic ratio
Eric Weisstein's World of Mathematics, Cubic Part
formula: Dirichlet g.f.: zeta(s)*zeta(3s-3)/zeta(3s). The Dirichlet convolution of this sequence with A050985 generates A000203. - _R. J. Mathar_, Apr 05 2011
Sum_{k=1..n} a(k) ~ 45 * Zeta(4/3) * n^(4/3) / (2*Pi^4). - _Vaclav Kotesovec_, Jan 31 2019
mathematica: upto=1000;Flatten[With[{c=Range[Floor[Surd[upto,3]],1,-1]^3}, Table[ Select[ c,Divisible[n,#]&,1],{n,upto}]]](* _Harvey P. Dale_, Apr 07 2013 *)
results.author: _N. J. A. Sloane_.
